title: Exploring the Effects of Inquiry-Based Learning in Science Education: Instructional Design Strategies for Pre-Service Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Core science subject knowledge and foundational understanding of educational principles
context.additional_context: Designed for pre-service teachers to understand inquiry-based learning strategies applicable in elementary and secondary science classes and apply confirmatory and structured inquiry methods in real educational settings. Self-directed learning is enabled via personal devices in an online asynchronous environment.

learning_goals: Preservice teachers will be able to explain the differences between confirmatory and structured inquiry and analyze the advantages and disadvantages of each.
Preservice teachers can evaluate the impact of inquiry-based learning on learners' success expectations and intrinsic value based on expectancy-value theory.
Preservice teachers can design non-face-to-face inquiry-based science lessons in an LMS environment and monitor learner engagement through formative assessment.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
